abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental impact
            assessment for the Integrated Development Project for
            Irrigated Agriculture for Mauritania, which aims to promote
            the sustainable increase of agricultural productivity and
            income in a rural environment, improve food security, and
            reduce poverty--all within the context of integrating the
            management of natural resources. To offset reduced water
            availability, water use will be monitored and divided up
            among users. Water drainage networks and environmental
            monitoring will restore soil salinity and check soil
            erosion. The water table will be maintained. Deforestation,
            ecological imbalances, biodiversity alterations, and the
            spread of water-borne diseases like bilharzia, will be
            mitigated by restricting irrigation to certain lands.
            Socio-economic impacts like the marginalization of certain
            groups will be addressed by providing supports for
            populations-at-risk. Building community infrastructure will
            reduce loss of social cohesion and the risk of social conflicts.
